definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: In those days the ark of the covenant of God was there, with Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, ministering before it.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫的孫子，以利亞撒的兒子非尼哈侍立在約櫃前。

sentences.english: Grandmother could not help weeping emotionally , and all the others present were also crying, including Daiyu.
sentences.chinese: 當下地下侍立之人，無不掩面涕泣，黛玉也哭個不住。

sentences.english: In front of the Buddha are two mighty stone lions; on two sides are four followers.
sentences.chinese: 主尊前有兩隻姿態雄健的石獅，左右侍立侍從。

sentences.english: Many princes and dukes were standing in front of her.
sentences.chinese: 她的面前侍立着不少王孫貴族。

sentences.english: And all that stood by him went out from him.
sentences.chinese: 於是左右侍立的人都退去了。

sentences.english: I came near unto one of them that stood by, and asked him the truth of all this.
sentences.chinese: 我就近一位侍立者，問他這一切的真情。

sentences.english: And waking, they saw his glory, and the two men that stood with him.
sentences.chinese: 他們一醒，就看見他的光耀和在他旁侍立的兩個人。

definition: to send away/to dismiss (servants etc)/to retire from public life
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to take a furtive look at
